page.description: Define the settings for the multi-state switch

discussion.p: The *[ui:Define switch states]* property is used to configure the switch states for a multi-state switch control. The multi-state switch control cycles through each state when clicked or tapped.

When clicked, the [...] smart field button opens the *[ui:Multi-state Switch Settings]* dialog. The states for the switch are managed using the Multi-state Switch Settings dialog. States can be added, modified, reordered, or deleted.
Every switch has a <Default> state. The <Default> state is required, cannot be deleted, and is always the last state listed in the list of States.

section.description: If the *[ui:Multi-state switch type]* is set to "HTML", the Multi-state Switch Settings dialog can be used to define the HTML shown when a state is selected.

If the *[ui:Multi-state switch type]* is set to "Icon", the Multi-state Switch Settings dialog can be used to define the image or icon shown when a state is selected. The icon can be an SVG image, a font icon, an image from the project, or a built-in Alpha Anywhere image.

item.name: Delete state
item.description: Delete the selected state. The <Default> state cannot be deleted.

item.name: Up
item.description: Move the selected state up. The <Default> state cannot be moved.

item.name: Down
item.description: Move the selected state down. The <Default> state cannot be moved.

item.name: Select icon
item.description: If the *[ui:Multi-state switch type]* is set to "Icon", the Select icon button is used to pick an icon from the project, an icon font, or a built in SVG or Alpha image.

item.name: HTML
item.description: If the *[ui:Multi-state switch type]* is set to "HTML", the HTML box is where HTML can be entered to define the displayed content when the switch state is selected.

item.name: Insert image
item.description: If the *[ui:Multi-state switch type]* is set to "HTML", the Insert image link can be used to insert an image from the project, an icon font, or built-in SVG or Alpha image.
